hotspots.label: Fossil Imprint
hotspots.fact: This is a fossil of an ancient sea creature called a trilobite that lived hundreds of millions of years ago. The detailed pattern you see shows the segments of its hard outer shell preserved in stone.

hotspots.label: Fine Detail Lines
hotspots.fact: These tiny lines show the texture of the trilobite's exoskeleton, which is like armor that protected its body. Scientists use these details to identify different species of trilobites.

hotspots.label: Rock Matrix
hotspots.fact: The tan and gray rock surrounding the fossil is called the matrix. It formed from sediment on the ocean floor and hardened over millions of years, preserving the trilobite inside.

hotspots.label: Segmented Body
hotspots.fact: You can see the trilobite's body is divided into segments, which helped it bend and move. Trilobites were some of the first animals with external skeletons!
